name: John Muyskens
body:
I am a computer science undergraduate at [Calvin College](http://www.calvin.edu/). I am interested in information design, from data visualization to user interfaces to graphic design. Bret Victor, Edward Tufte and Mike Bostock inspire me. I speak Python, Haskell and JavaScript. My other interests include listening to music, reading and biking. I work for the [Student Activities Office](http://www.calvin.edu/sao) at Calvin where we put on a concert season like no other. Our offerings also include recent movies, comedy and pop-culture lectures. I make posters advertising these events across campus, a service I also provide pro bono for the Film Arts Committee. I am also the Science & Technology Editor at our school newspaper, [The Chimes](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes). 

I display some of my graphic design work on my [tumblr](http://jmuys.tumblr.com/), along with whatever happens to be catching my interest at the moment.

[Here's my resume.](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uxculjv24xdSYqCtxWbhZx9M7TBJRfS4sorHPzjybTs/pub)

## Published work
* [Interactive data visualization of my school's enrollment data](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2013-14/enrollment/enrollment.html)
* [Graphical explanations of my school's budget mishap](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2012-13/budget/budget.htm)
* [On the Ubuntu Touch developer preview](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2013/03/14/canonical-gives-a-promising-preview-of-ubuntu-for-phones-and-tablets/)
* [On the latest Mersenne prime](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2013/02/15/largest-ever-mersenne-prime-number-discovered-has-millions-of-digits/)
* [On Aaron Swartz](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2013/02/01/aaron-swartz-indicted-in-jstor-downloading-is-dead/)
* [Interview with Peter Diamandis](http://www.calvin.edu/chimes/2013/01/23/peter-diamandis-speaks-about-the-consequences-of-an-abundant-future/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
